text: The 2018 LFA Primeira is the third season of the Liga Futebol Amadora Primeira Divisão. The season began on March 3 and originally finished on August 5,DALAN BA LIGA FUTEBOL AMADORA EPOCA 2018 but rescheduled to be finished on July 29. Karketu Dili is the current defending champions. Boavista won their first LFA Primeira title, with one match to spare following a 10–1 away win over Cacusan on 22 July 2018, while its competitor Karketu only drew 1–1 against Ponta Leste on 20 July 2018. Cacusan to be the first team who relegated to 2019 LFA Segunda, with four match to spare following a 0–10 loss against Karketu on 30 June 2018. DIT was the second team got relegated to 2019 LFA Segunda, with two match to spare following a 2–4 loss against Ponta Leste on 13 July 2018. ==Teams== There are 8 teams that will play this season. ===from Primeira=== FC Zebra and FC Porto Taibesse were relegated to 2018 Segunda Divisao after finished 7th and bottom place of 2017 Primeira Divisao. ===to Primeira=== Atlético Ultramar and DIT F.C. promoted to 2018 Primeira Divisao after securing place as champions and runners-up in 2017 Segunda Divisao. DIT F.C. returned to top flight after last season relegated to Segunda Divisao and Atlético Ultramar was newly promotion clubs. ===Name changes=== * Carsae FC was renamed to Boavista Futebol Clube Timor Leste in January 2018. ===Locations=== ===Personnel and kits=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Club !City / Area !Coach !Captain ! On 19 May 2018 Round 6 was rescheduled one more time from originally May 26–27 in Malibaca Yamato Stadium, Maliana and Baucau Municipal Stadium, Baucau move to May 25–28 in Kampo Demokrasia, Dili.Orariu Foun Primeira Divisaun LFA EPOCA 2018 Schedules for Round 8 to Round 14 was also announced at the same time. === Round 1 === === Round 2 === === Round 3 === === Round 4 === === Round 5 === === Round 6 === === Round 7 === === Round 8 === === Round 9 === === Round 10 === === Round 11 === === Round 12 === === Round 13 === === Round 14 === ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- |rowspan=1|1 |align="left"| Fábio Christian |align="left"|Atlético Ultramar |17 |- |rowspan=1|2 |align="left"| Bernardo Freire |align="left"|Atlético Ultramar |12 |- |rowspan=2|3 |align="left"| Henrique Cruz |align="left"|Boavista |10 |- |align="left"| Daniel Donkor |align="left"|Ponta Leste |10 |- |rowspan=1|5 |align="left"| Daniel Adadi |align="left"|Karketu Dili |9 |- |rowspan=3|6 |align="left"| Edit Savio |align="left"|Boavista |8 |- |align="left"| José Santos |align="left"|DIT |8 |- |align="left"| Rufino Gama |align="left"|Karketu Dili |8 |- |rowspan=1|9 |align="left"| Frangcyatma Kefi |align="left"|Boavista |7 |- |rowspan=1|10 |align="left"| Mario Aibekob |align="left"|Académica |6 |- |11 |colspan=2|2 players |5 |- |13 |colspan=2|6 players |4 |- |19 |colspan=2|7 players |3 |- |26 |colspan=2|14 players |2 |- |40 |colspan=2|24 players |1 |} ===Hat-tricks=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !
